biography.content:
Soy Catedrático de Universidad y Director y profesor del Dpto. de Economía y Administración de Empresas de la Universidad de Málaga (Escuela de Ingenierías Industriales). Soy Director del Grupo de Investigación, Operaciones y Sostenibilidad, Calidad, TIC y Prevención de Riesgos Laborales, y de la Cátedra de Prevención y Responsabilidad Social Corporativa. Soy Director del Laboratorio Observatorio de Gestión Preventiva en las PYME del Instituto Andaluz de Prevención de Riesgos Laborales de la Junta de Andalucía. He sido Academic Visiting en la School of Civil Engineering, trabajando en gestión de la prevención en la construcción durante 12 meses de la Universidad de Loughborough. Esta Escuela se sitúa en primera o segunda posición en el ranking británico, entre las Escuelas de Ingeniería Civil de UK de forma sostenida. Anteriormente fui responsable del servicio de PRL de la Mutua de la Seguridad Social Nº10 en Andalucía Oriental. 

Tengo amplia experiencia como consultor y asesor en gestión de la PRL, habiendo redactado informes de evaluación y auditoría, supervisiones de informes institucionales, realizado peritaciones judiciales, diseño e impartición de formación especializada, etc.

MI campo en la investigación es la Resilience Engineering, la  gestión de la PRL y  la Prevention Through Design. El sector de la construcción y las almazaras e industria en general, son los sectores donde más he trabajado. 

Soy Editor Asociado de Safety Science (Q1 en el JCR). He publicado en las mejores revistas de PRL del JCR, como Accident Analysis and Prevention, Safety Science, Journal of Safety Research, Reliability Engineering & System Safety, etc. Soy revisor de 12 revistas indexadas en el JCR y miembro del Comité Organizador/Científico de 16 Congresos Internacionales, como AHFE, SHO, ORP, CISEO, etc.
---
I am Full Professor of Management (Department of Economics and Business Administration at the University of Malaga,School of Industrial Engineering), Head of Management Department at University of Málaga, Director of Research Group of Operations and Sustainability: Quality, ITC and Occupational, Health & Safety, and Chair of Prevención and Corporate Social Responsibility.  I've been a Visiting Academic at the School of Civil Engineering in Loughborough University (first or second School in the ranking of UK steadily), working on OH&SManagement in construction for 12 months. Before, I was in charge of the Occupational Health & Safety Service of Eastern Andalusia of Social Labour Insurance from our Government.

I have extensive experience as a consultant and adviser in OHS management having written advisory reports, evaluation reports and audits, expert in trials, training design, etc.

My research is focused on OH&S management, Prevention Through Design and Engineering Resilience. The construction sector and the oil mills and general industry are the sectors where I worked.

I am Associate Editor Safety Science. I have published in Accident Analysis and Prevention, Safety Science, Journal of Safety Research, Reliability Engineering & System Safety, etc.. I am member of the Scientific/Organizing Committee of 16 International Conferences (SHO, ORP, AHFE, CISEO, etc.)

Virginia Herrera-Pérez, is a PhD Student from the University of Malaga, Spain. She has a Master Degree in Pharmacy. Currently she is working in the Research Group “Operations and Sustainability: Quality, ICT and Risk Prevention at Work and in the Chair of Prevention and Corporate Social Responsibility. She is also, Head of Marketing Department in DGlobal.

biography.content:
Dr. Viacheslav Osadchyi, Prof., Dean of the Faculty of Economics and Management

Viacheslav Osadchyi, born in 1975, received a Candidate of Pedagogical Sciences (PhD in Education) from the Vinnytsia State Pedagogical University named after Mykhailo Kotsiubynsky, Ukraine, in 2006, and a Doctor of Pedagogical Sciences from the Vinnytsia State Pedagogical University named after Mykhailo Kotsiubynsky, Ukraine, in 2013

Since 1999 before 2022, he worked in the field of information technology and vocational education at the Bogdan Khmelnitsky Melitopol state pedagogical university. 
Now - Dean of the Faculty of Economics and Management Borys Grinchenko Kyiv University.

Her research interests include: economy, management, practical psychology, computer science,  ICT, software development, information systems, data science. He has published a number of papers in international journals.

He is a Chief Editor of  "Educological Discourse", "Ukrainian Journal of Educational Studies and Information Technology" (Ukraine), and member of editorial boards of 
"Computing Conference (formerly called Science and Information (SAI) Conference)" (UK), Intelligent Systems Conference (IntelliSys) (The Netherlands), "International Conference on Higher Education Advances" (Spain), , FTC - Future Technologies Conference 2021 (Canada, з 2021 року), Future of Information and Communication Conference (San Francisco, United States, з 2022 року). "Transactions of Kremenchuk Mykhailo Ostrohradskyi National University" (Ukraine), "Information Technologies and Learning Tools" (Ukraine), "Scientific papers of Berdyansk State Pedagogical University" (Ukraine).

biography.content:
Professor at the Department of Applied Informatics at the Federal University of the State of Rio de Janeiro (UNIRIO, Brazil). PhD in Software Engineering from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (COPPE/UFRJ, Brazil). He was Academic Visitor at University College London (UCL, UK) and Postdoc Researcher at COPPE/UFRJ.

Head of the Complex Systems Engineering Laboratory (Lab ESC), leading a team of 20 students with more than 30 partners over the world. His research interests are Complex Systems Engineering (especially software ecosystems and systems-of-systems) and Software Engineering Education.

He is member of Education Evaluating Commission at the Brazilian Ministry of Education. In the Brazilian Computer Society (SBC), he is Coordinator of the Special Commission of Information Systems (CE-SI), member of the Special Commission of Games and Entertainment Computing (CE-Jogos), and member of the Interest Group of Computer Science Education (GIEC). He was member of the Special Commission of Software Engineering (CE-ES) (2021-2022).

He was Editor-in-Chief of iSys: Brazilian Journal of Information Systems (2017-2021). He also worked in several projects related to software process improvement and reuse management in large companies at Coppetec Foundation (2008-2017). He was also lecturer at Brazilian Open University, COPPE/UFRJ, UNIRIO, Infnet Institute, and Santa Úrsula University (2007-2017).

biography.content: Working as Freelance Developer since 1998, and Full-time lecturer in the University of Agriculture Peshawar since 2001. Done Masters in Computer Science in networks from the University of Agriculture Peshawar in 2010, Masters of Computer Science (database) in 2019, currently enrolled in PhD Program in The Islamia College University Peshawar.

Researcher and Engineer with a combined experience of ten years in R&D and teaching. Specializes in applied research with a focus on deep learning technology and its application to signal processing, natural language processing, and semantic web. Over 50 peer-reviewed journals and conference publications. Guest editor and a board member of IEEE Access Journals and HCI International Conference. HEC and UIUC scholarship holder. Loves traveling, enjoys classical music, and plays table tennis and chess.

biography.content:
Muhammad Sajjad received his MS degree in Computer Software Engineering in 2008 from National University of Sciences and Technology, Pakistan. From 2008 to 2012, he served as a lecturer in different renowned universities of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, where he provided additional duties other than teaching such as project coordinator and supervising research activities of BS and MS students. In 2012, he joined Intelligent Media Lab (IM Lab) as a research associate while enrolling as a PhD student in Sejong University, Seoul, South Korea.  In IM Lab, he worked on various projects related to image super-resolution, image quality assessment, video summarization and prioritization, and mixed reality. He also assisted his professor while writing research project proposal, supervising MS and newly inducted PhD students, and various other tasks related to teaching and management. After completing his PhD in 2015, he joined back his home university as an associate Professor, Islamia College Peshawar (Public Sector University). Currently, he is working as a Postdoctoral researcher in the computer science department, NTNU - Norwegian University of Science and Technology. He is also the leading researcher of digital image processing lab in computer science department, where many BS, MS, and PhD students are working on various projects such image/video retrieval, steganography, digital watermarking, resource constraint devices, fog computing, IoT, smart home, augmented reality, medical imaging analysis, and multi-disciplinary research projects. under his supervision. In addition, he is also in charge of quality enhancement cell and Training and Development Center (TDC) as Dy. Director and Director respectively, playing an active role in capacity building, improving teaching quality, and enhancing academia. Moreover, he is in strong research collaboration with IM lab where he assist his professor (supervisor), remotely supervising and guiding PhD and Master students in various tasks such as proposing new ideas, giving his valuable suggestions during experiments, and providing support in writing and revising project proposals and research papers. 
He has published 50+ papers in peer-reviewed international journals and conferences such as IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics, Information sciences, Information Fusion, Journal of computational science, IEEE Internet of Things Journal, Neurocomputing, Sensors, Journal of Visual Communication and Image Representation, Multimedia Tools and Applications, Computers in Biology and Medicine, Journal of Medical Systems, Signal, Image and Video Processing, Bio-Medical Materials, Future Generation Computer Systems and Engineering, KSII Transactions on Internet and Information Systems, NBIS 2015, MITA 2015, and PlatCon 2016. He is serving as a professional reviewer for numerous well-reputed journals such as Journal of Visual Communication and Image Representation (11), Future Generation Computer Systems (4), Journal of SuperComputing (2), Signal Image and Video Processing (5), Multimedia Tools and Applications (5), ACM Transactions on Embedded Computing Systems (5), and Enterprise Information Systems (3). He is as an Associate Editor for IEEE Access and Guest Editor for, Special Issue on " Neurocomputing Methods for Innovative Multimedia Systems" in Computational Intelligence and Neuroscience.

biography.content: I am Ihsan Ali, currently working as a research associate at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, University of Malaya. I have published over 60 high-impact research journal papers, including highly reputable journals, IEEE communications surveys and tutorials, and Communication Magazine, with more than 250+ cumulative impact factors. I have been actively involved in research and teaching activities for the last 10 years in different countries, including Saudi Arabia, USA, Pakistan, and Malaysia. I am a member of the editorial board of different journals, including Wireless Communications and Mobile Computing and the Journal of Computer Networks and Communications. I am also the lead GE of the special issue on Data Collection in Resource-Limited Networks (WSNs, IoT, Sensor Cloud). I have served as a technical program committee member for several well-known conferences, including IWCMC2017-2018, AINIS 2017, Future 5V 2017, ICACCI-2018, INAIT 2019, DiCES-N19, CCNC2020, ICCAIS2020, and CSNT2020, and an organizer of the special session on fog computing in Future 5V 2017. I have also participated in and organized several conferences and workshops in different countries. I am also an active reviewer for several high-repute journals, including Computers & Electrical Engineering, KSII Transactions on Internet and Information Systems, Mobile Networks and Applications, International Journal of Distributed Sensor Networks, Journal of Advanced Transportation, IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems, Computer Networks, IEEE Access, wireless communications, and Mobile Computing, and IEEE Communication Magazine. I am a Senior Member (IEEE), Professional Member (ACM, BCS), Associate Member (ACS), and Professional Technologist (Ts.) (MBOT). My research interests include Wireless Sensor Networks, Cloud Computing, Sensor Cloud, Fog Computing, IoT, and Underwater Sensor Networks.

Dominio de modernas tecnologías y herramientas de gestión relacionadas con el área de Operaciones, I+D+i 
 y Desarrollo de Negocio, tras el paso por PYMES y por prestigiosas multinacionales, habiendo desempeñando un amplio abanico de funciones directivas durante más de veinte años en el área industrial.  
Sólida experiencia en gestión de equipos multidisciplinares. 
Experiencia docente de más diez años en entornos universitarios en las áreas de organización de empresas e innovación.  Ponente habitual en cursos de formación permanente de universitarios en Dirección de Empresas y en foros sectoriales. Redacción de manuales vinculados con la actividad innovadora en la empresa. 
Estudios de doctorado e investigación relacionados con la Inteligencia Competitiva, disciplina incipiente en nuestro entorno empresarial.

biography.content: Methanias Colaço Júnior holds a Ph.D. in software engineering business intelligence from the Federal University of Bahia. He also holds a M.Sc. in computer science from the Federal University of Campina Grande (UFCG). He started his professional activities in 1993, and joined the Tiradentes University and Federal University of Sergipe as a Professor in 1996. He is a consultant in several technology fields and to several enterprises in Brazil, with special emphasis in Data Science, Data Mining, Business Intelligence, Experimentation, BPM, Strategic Management, Big Data Analytics, Neurolinguistic, CRM, BSC, Audit, Education, Governance and Public Security. Colaço also is a Professor in the Computer Science and Business Administration at Federal University of Sergipe, Brazil,  where he is part of two academic research programs: (i) Postgraduate Program in Computer Science – PROCC; (ii) Competitive Intelligence Research and Practice Group – NUPIC. He is a lecturer in seminars and enterprise courses about Experimental Software Engineering, Data Science, Business Intelligence, Data Mining, Experimentation, Neurolinguistics, Customer Relationship Management, Balanced ScoreCard, Big Data Analytics, Strategic Management, BPM, and Decision Support Systems.

other-name.content: Willibrordus Martinus Pancratius van der Aalst

biography.content: Prof.dr.ir. Wil van der Aalst is a full professor at RWTH Aachen University, leading the Process and Data Science (PADS) group. He is also the Chief Scientist at Celonis, part-time affiliated with the Fraunhofer-Institut für Angewandte Informationstechnik (FIT), and a member of the Board of Governors of Tilburg University. He also has unpaid professorship positions at Queensland University of Technology (since 2003) and the Technische Universiteit Eindhoven (TU/e). Until December 2017, he was the scientific director of the Data Science Center Eindhoven (DSC/e) and led the Architecture of Information Systems group at TU/e. Currently, he is also a distinguished fellow of Fondazione Bruno Kessler (FBK) in Trento, deputy CEO of the Internet of Production (IoP) Cluster of Excellence, co-director of the RWTH Center for Artificial Intelligence. His research interests include process mining, Petri nets, business process management, workflow automation, simulation, process modeling, and model-based analysis. Wil van der Aalst has published more than 275 journal papers, 35 books (as author or editor), 630 refereed conference/workshop publications, and 85 book chapters. Many of his papers are highly cited (he is one of the most-cited computer scientists in the world and has an H-index of 170 according to Google Scholar with over 130,000 citations), and his ideas have influenced researchers, software developers, and standardization committees working on process support. He has been a co-chair of many conferences, including the Business Process Management conference, the International Conference on Cooperative Information Systems, the International Conference on the Application and Theory of Petri Nets, the International Conference on Process Mining, and the IEEE International Conference on Services Computing. He is also editor/member of the editorial board of several journals, including Business & Information Systems Engineering, Computing, Distributed and Parallel Databases, Software and Systems Modeling, Computer Supported Cooperative Work, the International Journal of Business Process Integration and Management, the International Journal on Enterprise Modelling and Information Systems Architectures, Computers in Industry, IEEE Transactions on Services Computing, Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing, and Transactions on Petri Nets and Other Models of Concurrency. He chaired the steering committee of IEEE Task Force on Process Mining from 2009 until 2021 and chaired the steering committee of the International Conference Series on Business Process Management from 2003 until 2017. He previously served on the advisory boards of several organizations, including Fluxicon, Celonis, ProcessGold/UiPath, and aiConomix/Automaited. In 2012, he received the degree of doctor honoris causa from Hasselt University in Belgium. He also served as scientific director of the International Laboratory of Process-Aware Information Systems of the National Research University, Higher School of Economics in Moscow. In 2013, he was appointed as Distinguished University Professor of TU/e and was awarded an honorary guest professorship at Tsinghua University. In 2015, he was appointed as an honorary professor at the National Research University, Higher School of Economics in Moscow. He is also an IFIP Fellow, IEEE Fellow, ACM Fellow, and elected member of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (Koninklijke Nederlandse Akademie van Wetenschappen), Royal Holland Society of Sciences and Humanities (Koninklijke Hollandsche Maatschappij der Wetenschappen), the Academy of Europe (Academia Europaea), the North Rhine-Westphalian Academy of Sciences, Humanities and the Arts (Nordrhein-Westfälische Akademie der Wissenschaften und der Künste), and the German Academy of Science and Engineering (Deutsche Akademie der Technikwissenschaften). In 2018 he was awarded an Alexander-von-Humboldt Professorship, Germany’s most valuable research award (five million euros).

biography.content:
Bokolo Anthony Jnr. is a Senior Researcher at Department of Applied Data Science, Institute for Energy Technology (IFE), Norway. He is also an Associate Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Communication, Østfold University College, Norway. He contributes to the disciplines of DigiEd, DigiHealth, DigiTech, and DigiWork in "digital society" https://www.hiof.no/english/research/priority-areas/the-digital-society/
He works on application of emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, internet of things, and distributed ledger technologies in research areas related to smart cities for smart mobility, smart health, sustainable energy towards achieving the UN sustainable development goals in the society.

Overall his research interest includes;
 -Digital ecosystems for smart cities (smart environments, intelligent systems, distributed systems, and data management). 
-Data-sharing in smart cities (data markets, data governance, distributed ledger technologies, and big data technologies).
- Data-driven citizen centered service innovation in smart cities (public services, mobility, and sharing economy).
- Sustainable smart cities (energy informatics, citizen behaviour change, climate change mitigation and adaptation).

biography.content: Ernesto Damiani is a professor of computer science at the University of Milan, where he leads the SEcure Service-oriented Architectures Research (SESAR) Lab. He is also the co-director of the IRIXYS French-German-Italian research center (www.irixys.org). On leave from Milan, he is the Director of the Center on Cyber-Physical Systems at Khalifa University, in the UAE. He has held visiting positions at  George Mason University (US), University of Technology Sydney (Australia), Tokyo Denki University (Japan) and Université de Bourgogne (France). Damiani received a honorary doctorate from Institut national des sciences appliquées, Lyon, France (2017). His research spans security, Big Data and knowledge processing, where he has published over 400 peer-reviewed articles and books. He is a Senior Member of the IEEE and a Distinguished Scientist of ACM.

biography.content:
Halim Yanikomeroglu received the BSc degree in electrical and electronics engineering from the Middle East Technical University, Ankara, Turkey, in 1990, and the MASc degree in electrical engineering (now ECE) and the PhD degree in electrical and computer engineering from the University of Toronto, Canada, in 1992 and 1998, respectively. Since 1998 he has been with the Department of Systems and Computer Engineering at Carleton University, Ottawa, Canada, where he is now a Full Professor. His research interests cover many aspects of wireless communications and networks. He has given 110+ invited seminars, keynotes, panel talks, and tutorials in the last five years. Dr. Yanikomeroglu’s collaborative research with industry resulted in 39 granted patents. Dr. Yanikomeroglu is a Fellow of the IEEE, the Engineering Institute of Canada (EIC), and the Canadian Academy of Engineering (CAE). He is a Distinguished Speaker for the IEEE Communications Society and the IEEE Vehicular Technology Society, and an Expert Panelist of the Council of Canadian Academies (CCA|CAC). 

Dr. Yanikomeroglu is currently serving as the Chair of the Steering Committee of IEEE’s flagship wireless event, Wireless Communications and Networking Conference (WCNC). He is also a member of the IEEE ComSoc GIMS, IEEE ComSoc Conference Council, and IEEE PIMRC Steering Committee. He served as the General Chair and Technical Program Chair of several IEEE conferences. He has also served in the editorial boards of various IEEE periodicals. 

Dr. Yanikomeroglu received several awards for his research, teaching, and service, including the IEEE ComSoc Fred W. Ellersick Prize (2021), IEEE VTS Stuart Meyer Memorial Award (2020), and IEEE ComSoc Wireless Communications TC Recognition Award (2018). He received best paper awards at IEEE Competition on Non-Terrestrial Networks for B5G and 6G in 2022 (grand prize), IEEE ICC 2021, IEEE WISEE 2021 and 2022.

biography.content: Armando Sérgio de Aguiar Filho possui Doutorado em Gestão da Informação e do Conhecimento pelo Programa de Pós-Graduação em Ciência da Informação da UFMG. É Mestre em Administração, ênfase em Gestão da Informação, pela Fundação João Pinheiro/MG. Fez MBA em Gestão de Negócios pelo IBMEC/MG e Especialização em Marketing pela Fundação João Pinheiro/MG. É Graduado em Comunicação Social/Habilitação Publicidade & Propaganda pelo UNIBH/MG. Tem experiência em projetos de pesquisa e desenvolvimento nas temáticas de marketing, empreendedorismo, inovação, aprendizagem e compartilhamento. Na carreira acadêmica tem mais de 20 anos de experiência, tendo produzido considerável número de trabalhos completos publicados em periódicos e anais de congressos nacionais e internacionais. Na sua trajetória vem desenvolvendo atividades de coordenação, docência, pesquisa e extensão em instituições de destaque como FUMEC, Promove, UNIBH e PUC Minas. Desde 2017 é professor permanente do Programa de Pós-Graduação em Sistemas de Informação e Gestão do Conhecimento da Universidade FUMEC, sendo designado como Coordenador do Programa a partir de fevereiro de 2022. No âmbito de mercado possui sólida atuação como gestor de comunicação e marketing no comércio, indústria e consultoria. Desde 2015 atua fortemente com atividades relacionadas ao estudo, desenvolvimento e acompanhamento de indicadores de performance acadêmica. É Avaliador do INEP/MEC para atos de autorização, reconhecimento e renovação de cursos de graduação presencial e EaD e colaborador do BNI para elaboração e revisão de itens.

biography.content:
Maria Cláudia Cavalcanti received the D.Sc. degree in computer engineering from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro-RJ, Brazil, in 2003.
She has been active in the database research com- munity for more than ten years. From 1985 to 2004, she was a System Analyst with the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ). Since 2004, she has been a Faculty Member with the Computer Engineering Department, Military Institute of Engineering (IME), Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. In addition,
she has been collaborating with the Computational Biology and Systems Doctoral Program at FIOCRUZ, Brazil, since 2008. Her current research interests include data and metadata management on distributed architectures, Web of data, as well as ontology reuse and interoperability.

keyword.content: metadata, ontologies, semantic Web, data interoperability, data modeling, data provenance

biography.content: I am assistant professor of computer science with Jendouba University, Tunisia, and member of DOCSYS research team at VPNC research laboratory. I received my PhD in computer science from Paul Sabatier University, France in 2013. My research interests include knowledge acquisition and modelling, natural language processing and terminology-based knowledge engineering. My work benefits from collaborations with linguists and researchers in human factors. Contributions include methods and platforms for ontology engineering from text, tools for pattern-based semantic relation extraction, and knowledge representation to add lexical data to ontologies, with applications in semantic annotation and information retrieval.

biography.content: Jorge Miguel Ferreira da Silva Mendes graduated in Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Tras-os-Montes e Alto Douro (UTAD), Portugal, in 2014 and a Master’s degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering obtained from the UTAD in 2016. He is currently an integrated member of the Centre for Robotics and Intelligent Systems in Institute of Integrated Systems and Computer Engineering of Porto (INESC TEC) and PhD student in Electrical and Computer Engineering at UTAD. His research focuses on visual perception and robotic navigation for agriculture and his main areas of interest include sensors, Internet of Things and robotic in the context of Precision Agriculture.

biography.content: Tatiana M. Pinho graduated in Energy Engineering from the University of Trás-os-Montes e Alto Douro (UTAD), Portugal, in 2011 and received the MSc degree in Energy Engineering from UTAD, in 2013. In 2018, she received the Ph.D. degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering in UTAD and INESC TEC Technology and Science, supported by the FCT. Presently she is a researcher at the INESC TEC and her research interests include systems’ modelling and adaptive control, in particular Model Predictive Control, applied to agri-forestry systems.

Filipe Neves dos Santos was born in 1979 in São Paio de Oleiros, Portugal. He obtained a Licenciatura (5-year degree) in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Instituto Superior de Engenharia do Porto (ISEP) in 2003, followed by a M.Sc. in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the Instituto Superior Técnico (IST) da Universidade Técnica de Lisboa in 2007. In 2014, he received his PhD in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Faculdade de Engenharia (FEUP), Universidade do Porto, Portugal.

Filipe's primary focus is on developing autonomous robots and machinery to address real-world problems and needs, and to promote self-sustainability and fairness in the global economy. He is currently concentrating his efforts on developing and researching robotic solutions for the agriculture and forestry sector, which plays a crucial role in ensuring world self-sustainability.

In particular, Filipe is interested in developing robots that can function autonomously and safely in steep-slope scenarios, which is a common reality in the North of Portugal and many other regions worldwide. He aims to promote agricultural robotic projects and develop robots for specific tasks such as monitoring, spraying, logistics, pruning, and selective harvesting. These tasks are largely dependent on the robustness of specific robotic systems, such as visual perception, navigation (localization, mapping, and path planning), and manipulation and end tools.

Filipe's primary research fields within robotics research are Visual Perception and Navigation. His background in Electronics and Computer Engineering (Bachelor, MSc, and PhD), experience as an entrepreneur (4 years in a technological startup), robotics researcher (14 years), manager (6 years in a family enterprise supporting tasks), and electronics technician (6 years) positions him well to successfully contribute to the future of agricultural and forestall robotics.

biography.content:
Emanuel Peres completed the Degree in Electrical Engineering in 2003 and, in 2011, obtained the degree of Doctor in Engineering Sciences, with the thesis “Multi-technology access point for local data processing and support for viticulture applications precision”. Since 2011 he has been Assistant Professor at the Department of Engineering (DE), at the School of Science and Technology (ECT), at UTAD.

He taught and / or conducted more than 38 different curricular units, mainly in the area of computer engineering. The average results of students' pedagogical questionnaires, regarding its teaching performance, is invariably between Very Good and Excellent. He participated in the creation and restructuring of several study cycles, among which the Bachelor's and Master's degrees in Communication and Multimedia, as well as the TECHAGRO PhD. Since 2007, practically uninterruptedly, he has carried out different functions and management tasks. He is currently deputy director of the Master in Multimedia Technology (MTM).

He is an integrated member of CITAB and a collaborator in INESC TEC. He is responsible or participated in preparation of proposals and in the execution of 19 research and technological development (R&D) projects, as well as 9 projects for the provision of specialized services, having assumed the role of researcher in charge (IR) or coordinator at UTAD in 6 of them. He is currently co-IR of a Mobilizing Agenda-Vine & Wine PT-under the DPRR, with a funding amount of 7.8 M € for UTAD. He has also been active in preparing funding proposals for national and European calls.

He has filed several provisional national and international patent applications. However, of these, only two advanced to a definitive patent application. He obtained, both as a competitor and as a supervisor, several prizes in national competitions and in an international one.

Emanuel Peres supervised 5 doctorates, 33 masters and 342 BsC projects, having also participated in several juries of academic tests. He was the author of 96 publications indexed in the Scopus database and 72 publications indexed in the WoS database. Of these, 30 are in the JCR. He has a Scopus h-index of 19 and WoS h-index of 17.

He is a member of the editorial boards of three international JCR journals in the area of remote sensing. He has, on several occasions, played the role of guest editor for special issues in international magazines. He has been a member of the organization and also of the scientific committees of numerous indexed international conferences. He has reviewed over 75 articles for journals listed in the JCR, over 25 for journals indexed in WoS and/or Scopus databases, and over 95 articles for national and international conferences, most of which are indexed.

He is frequently invited to give lectures and workshops in the areas of digital agriculture and cybersecurity.

biography.content:
Mario Cunha - MC (Male), received a B.S., a M.Sc. and a PhD degrees in Agrarian Sciences and is currently an Associate Professor with habilitation at Sciences Faculty - University of Porto (FCUP) and senior researcher at the Institute for Systems and Computer Engineering, Technology and Science (INESC-TEC), TEC4AGRO-FOOD, Centre for Robotics in Industry and Intelligent Systems (CRIIS). He also collaborates formally with the Geo-Space Sciences Research Centre (CICGE) and was visiting researcher at the international researcher centres: ¿Alterra - Wageningen UR¿, NL (3 months) and ¿Centre for Agri-Environmental Research - CAER¿, University of Reading, UK (6 months). MC¿s research interests include various topics in agronomy and agricultural engineering mostly focused on Crop phenotyping, Precision agriculture, Remote sensing applications (climate change included), Crop modelling (statistical or process-based), Crop yield forecast and Agricultural machinery. He represents the INESCTEC in the newly created European Plant Phenotyping-Research Infrastructure (EPP-RI), which acts in articulation with the EMPHASIS project (https://emphasis.plant-phenotyping.eu/). The excellence of his research was recognized internationally by the 'Syngenta Innovation in Agriculture Award' in 2007s with the work 'Spray_image App® for automatic evaluation of crop spray quality'. Regarding scientific publications, MC was the (co)author of more than 160 scientific publications (Orcid), including over 100 scientific papers published in journals listed in JCR-WoS and/or SCOPUS (h-index 27) and 12 peer-reviewed scientific book chapters. MC is/was the principal investigator or institutional leader of 14 research projects and participated in the team of 32 R&D projects with different funding sources such as FCT, H2020, P2020, Aga Khan, LIFE. Highlight the MC¿ participation, through INESCTEC, in the EU-funded large-scale project, ¿DEMETER - Building an Interoperable, Data-Driven, Innovative and Sustainable European Agri-Food Sector¿, topic DT-ICT-08-2019 - Agricultural digital integration platforms. MC is co-leader of the project ¿SpecTOM ¿ Metabolomics Tomography Spectroscopy System¿, which won the competitive Merit Grant, ¿Business Ignition Programme ¿ 2021¿ (BIP PROOF) (https://bip.up.pt/bip-proof/). He has the record of intellectual property of the Spray_image App® (Copyright transferred to Syngenta-Basel), the MaChoice® program and the ACFertS® program. He maintains consistent (>5 years) agronomic technology transfer programs with 5 international institutions/companies and 3 Portuguese institutions/companies. MC is/was the evaluator of several projects (R&D) applicants for funding (National/International), scholarship evaluation programs of PhD and Posdoc (e.g ERASMUS Mundus, FCT PhD grants), integrates the editorial board of two journals listed in WoS-JCR ¿Open agriculture¿ and ¿remote Sensing, section of agriculture and vegetation¿ and is reviewer assiduous of >30 scientific journals listed in the base JCR-WoS, having reviewed more than 100 papers. In terms of academics, MC supervise(d) 5 post-doctoral grants, 19 PhD students and 38 M.Sc. students, teaches courses in the 1st, 2nd and 3rd cycles in the areas of agronomy, food science and remote sensing, is Co-Director of the M.Sc. in Agronomy and the Director of the PhD program in Agrarian Sciences at FCUP.
 Porto, November 2021.

keyword.content: Crop Yield forecast, Agricultural engineering, remote sensing, bioclimate and environment.

organization.name: Universidade do Porto Faculdade de Ciências
Associação para o Desenvolvimento da Viticultura Duriense

biography.content: Raul Morais dos Santos is currently an Associate Professor with Habilitation at the Engineering Department – School of Sciences and Technology of the University of Trás-os-Montes e Alto Douro (UTAD), Vila Real – Portugal (https://www.utad.pt). Academic degrees: Habilitation in Electrical and Computer Engineering at the UTAD in 2009; PhD in Electrical and Computer Engineering (specialty microelectronics) at the UTAD in 2004; MSc in Industrial Eletronics at the University of Minho in 1998; Graduation in Electrical Engineering (branch of Electronics, Instrumentation and Computer Science) at the UTAD in 1993. Area of expertise: sensors and sensor interfaces in CMOS microelectronics, energy harvesting techniques to power small and unattended electronic devices, wireless sensor networks, Internet of Things in the context of agriculture/precision viticulture. Another area of interest is in the field of biomedical implantable devices, especially in biotelemetry systems regarding vibration microgenerators to produce electric energy inside smart prosthesis. Current R&D Centre: Senior Researcher for the Centre for the Research and Technology of Agro-Environmental and Biological Sciences (CITAB) and Collaborator for the Institute for Systems and Computer Engineering, Technology and Science (INESC TEC). Projects: Member of 11 research projects, 4 of them international. UTAD Coordinator of the PRR Agenda Mobilizadora Vine & Wine and Coordinator of the POCTEP/INTERREG VA project “SIAPD - Sistema Integrado transregional de apoio ao combate de pragas e doenças na agricultura”. Authorship: More than 100 Scopus-indexed papers (h-index: 24). Past & ongoing supervision: 13 PhD, 50 MSc and 60 scholarships.

keyword.content: Machine Intelligence; Digital Forensics; Reasoning for Complex Data

biography.content: Graduate at Bacharelado em Informática from Universidade Regional do Noroeste do Estado do Rio Grande do Sul (1995), master's at Computer Science from Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina (1997) and ph.d. at Computer Science from Universidade Federal Fluminense (2008). Cristiano Maciel is a researcher at the “Interactive Virtual Environments Laboratory” (LAVI) and a professor in the Institute of Computing, in the Federal University of Mato Grosso - Brazil. At the moment, he is the Brazilian Computer Society (SBC) adisor, as well as a member of the Special Commission on HCI and its Executive Council (CEIHC - SBC). His technical interests in Human-Computer Interaction area are mainly related to post-mortem digital legacy, social networks, online education and Web-based interaction.
